action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the side table, the book in the refrigerator and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
The cupboard is openable and currently closed. You can't see the cupboard's contents because it is closed.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a living room, a kitchen and a broom closet here.
You take the potted plant. In your inventory you have a plate and a potted plant.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You put the potted plant on the table.
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a peach, a banana, a sandwich and a orange.
You can't see a book here.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a counter, a cupboard and a potted plant. The cupboard is open. The potted plant is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You can't see a book here.
There is nothing on the counter.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a book and a couch. The book is on the table. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a hallway here.
You can't see a table here.
Livingroom is not an entity. (this should not occur.)

You are in a kitchen now. There are a table, a counter, a cupboard and a potted plant. The cupboard is open. The potted plant is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You can't see a book here.
I don't know what 'counter again' means.
There is nothing on the counter.
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a peach, a banana, a sandwich and a orange.
You can't see a book here.
There are a apple, a peach, a banana, a sandwich and a orange in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is openable and currently open.
> take book from inside of refrigerator
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know what 'inside refrigerator' means.
You can't see a book here.
> take book from inside of refrigerator
I don't know what you mean.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a peach, a banana, a sandwich and a orange.
I don't know what 'inside refrigerator' means.
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know what 'inside refrigerator' means.
> open refrigerator and take book from inside
I don't know what you mean.
I don't know what 'inside refrigerator' means.
> open refrigerator and take book from inside
